revised_title: Macroscopic Anatomy of the Central Nervous System in Plagiostomata
tldr: The author examines the macroscopic anatomy of the central nervous system in various species of Plagiostomata, focusing on the brain's structure and components. The study investigates the brain's external appearance, ventricles, olfactory lobes, cerebrum, thalamencephalon, mesencephalon, optic lobes, cerebellum, and medulla oblongata, providing a detailed description of each part and its function in these animals.
